result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bernadette A Rock was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bernadette A Rock in court for voluntary appearance with attorney James Jay Rennicke.  ADA John Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court cancels warrant. 
Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of amended complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF pleads Not Guilty, plea entered by court.  DEF atty has requested a substitution of Judge.  State requests $500 cash bond, DE asks for signature.  Court orders $750 signature bond, standard STOP conditions and DE prohibited from being on the premises of any establishment that serves alcohol by the drink.  Scheduling conference with current Judge Wright for time being-  10-7-14 @ 2:30.

Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.

Defendant shall not be on the premises of any establishment that serves alcohol by the drink.
